value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">There is <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-lond" key="London">London</rs>, there is the <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-arch" key="Archbishop of Canterbury">Archbishop of Canterbury</rs>. <del>But at</del></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-merl" key="Merlin">Merlin</rs> casts his enchartments, <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-morg" key="Morgan le Fay">Morgan Le Fay</rs> turns herself into</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>a stone; & <del>the</del> English roads are</del> but Knights are</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">riding the roads; the roads lead to castles where</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Knights lie [illeg.]; <del>the</del> Four Queens pace on white</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">mules; <del>the</del> a ship with silver sails down to the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">water: <del>the</del> Morgan le Fay turns herself to stone;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the hand rises from the lake holding <rs type="object" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#obj-exca" key="Excalibur">Excalibur</rs>.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>Is it a child's story? No, for the</del> The</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">candour is like a child's; yet it is not a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">story told to children. There is evil in the word; love; & </l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>gr</del> sorrow. <del>It tells a</del> <add place="above">The story is the</add> story that we tell. <add place="above">we tell</add>. But</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the proportions are different. <del>There is no</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>perspective. The</del> It has not our perspective</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>There is repetition; catalogue; dream;</del> The</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[illeg.] is very [tableau?]. <del>Like children, the Kings</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The catalogue is made after a childs </l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">particularity. <del>And this,</del> Bit this is the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">clear eye that sees so definitively; & <del>the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">without exaggeration. For there is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>a</del> this limpid [disclosure?] of what was real;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">there is no [sune?] & the [pictaugue?]; & the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">beauty is <del>the</del> in the object, not in the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">writers manipulations      "</l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="block" source="#">
            <l><add place="margin">61</add>"– so he went in & <del>looked</del> searched from</l>
          <l>chamber to chamber, & found her bed,</l>
          <l>but she was not there; there Balin</l>
          <l>looked into a fair little garden, & under a</l>
          <l>laurel tree he saw her lie under a</l>
          <l>[street?] of green samite, & a Knight with her</l>
          <l>& under their heads grass & herbs"...</l>
          </quote>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="block" source="#">
            <l><add place="margin">79</add> Then the King looked about the wood...</l>
          </quote>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It is but a childs world; it is a world</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">before <del>the</del> self consciousness had added any</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">mirror. There are men & women</l>
